Hi Bert, Thanks for the clarification. I followed the steps in the
presenta=
tion and have now got the lib library. But i still have one
more problem. I=
 was trying to build the cxx examples project but in
the linking step it fa=
ils as it is unable to find the cvode.lib file
and the recipes.lib file. I =
tried to look for the cvode.lib file but
couldnt find it. Also i tried to r=
un the configure script that comes
with the sundials package using cygwin b=
ut was unable to get it to
work. Would you have any suggestions to fix this=
. Thanks in advance,
Shyam.


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Bert Bell" <=
robert.bell@...> wrote:
>
> The Cantera msi installer only includes the stu=
ff you need to run
Cantera
> with Python and Matlab.
> 
>  
> 
> For C/C++ =
development  download the Cantera 1.7 source zip and build
> Cantera.  One =
of the projects is SetupCantera and another
SetupCanteraLite
> (what alread=
y have installed).  I always build SetupCantera and then
from
> that projec=
ts release directory I run Setup (It requires
uninstalling the
> current ca=
ntera install)  You will then have the include files and
the lib
> files ne=
eded for building Cantera C/C++ applications, including a
C++ .NET
> soluti=
on that has the demo project setup for building.
> 
>

> Hi, I am try=
ing to compile the demo program demo.ccp in Visual
> Studio.NET. My Cantera=
 installation (latest) did not produce any lib
> directory with the library=
 files that i need to include in the linker
> directive while building the =
demo.cpp file. (ex: cantera.lib, oneD.lib
> etc.) I have two DLL files in t=
he Cantera directory: msvcp71.dll and
> msvcr71.dll. Is there a way to buil=
d the demo without the lib files. I
> thought lib files were required at li=
nk time to link to the dll files.
> Has anybody faced this issue and got it=
 solved?
> Thanks in advance, Shyam.
>
